instruction: What is the overall goal of developing a method for early identification of bruised lemon fruits using 3D-convolutional neural networks (3D-CNN) via a local spectral-spatial hyperspectral imaging technique?
Output: The overall goal of developing a method for early identification of bruised lemon fruits using 3D-convolutional neural networks (3D-CNN) via a local spectral-spatial hyperspectral imaging technique is to detect and classify bruised lemons at an early stage. This method aims to prevent low-quality fruit from entering the consumer market by identifying and separating bruised lemons from healthy ones.

instruction: How does the classification accuracy of the ResNet model compare to other models in the study on early identification of bruised lemon fruits using 3D-convolutional neural networks (3D-CNN) via a local spectral-spatial hyperspectral imaging technique?
Output: The classification accuracy of the ResNet model in the study on early identification of bruised lemon fruits using 3D-CNN was the highest among all the models tested. It achieved a classification accuracy of 90.47%. In comparison, the DenseNet model had a classification accuracy of 85.71%, the ShuffleNet model had a classification accuracy of 80.95%, and the MobileNet model had a classification accuracy of 73.80%.
